volop.name: Food Rescuer - Glassboro/Gloucester County, NJ to Gloucester Township/Camden County, NJ
volop.description:
Our volunteers recover healthy meals from commercial donor cafeterias and deliver them to specified nearby non-profit organizations. Every meal saved stays out of the landfill, helping the environment, while also nourishing our community in need. The volunteer role would involve:- Picking up meals from our donor cafeterias on the campus of Rowan University (two locations - Holly Pointe and Marketplace, approximately 5 minutes from each other) in Glassboro and- Delivering these meals to our non-profit community partner, Unforgotten Haven, in Gloucester Township.

During the summer of 2025, we need volunteers for catering events only which are sporadic (ad hoc donations), and they are picked up only from Marketplace and delivered to Unforgotten Haven.

Starting in mid-August/September 2025 pick up and deliveries will take place on Wednesdays at 9:00 a.m. and Fridays at 4:00 p.m. and will involve pick ups from Marketplace and Holly Pointe at Rowan.

Each volunteer task will take approximately one hour including travel time between donor and recipient.

The distance between the donor and the recipient community partner is approximately 20 minutes.

We require volunteers to drive their own car. We welcome regular participation but will work with your schedule. Insulated bags will be provided to carry food donations.We are looking for volunteers in Gloucester County who would be close to Rowan University and/or Gloucester Township.

address.full: 120 John Street, PRINCETON, New Jersey, US

volop.commitmentDetails: Volunteer jobs usually take about 60 minutes. We welcome regular participation but will work with your schedule.
volop.otherRequirements: Volunteers will need access to a car, a valid driver's license and adequate auto insurance. They will also need a smartphone and be comfortable lifting and carrying large bags containing several meal trays.
